site_name: HAWAIIAN AIRLINES INC. - BOS - Boston Logan International Airport

citations.desc: Consignments to carriers and intermediate handlers.
citations.narrative:
A 3 year old American Bully, "Tunda," was transported from Honolulu to Boston on flight HA090 on May 31st, 2023 (AWB
173-11228571). On the exterior of the enclosure, there was a "Live Animal Checklist" form with a space for a certification
by the consignor of the last time food and water was offered and for feeding instructions over a 24 hour period, but that
section of the form was blank. The dog was transported without this required information. The certification and feeding
and watering instructions are important to ensure an animal being transported is offered food and water with sufficient
frequency to provide for the animal's health and well being.
Carriers and intermediate handlers must not accept a dog for transport in commerce unless the consignor certifies in
writing that the dog was offered food and water within 4 hours of transport and provides specific instructions for feeding
and watering in a 24 hour period. The certification and instructions must be securely attached to the outside of the
enclosure and easily read.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with airline representatives.
n

narrative:
3.14(c)(3) 
   
Consignments to carriers and intermediate handlers. 
A 3 year old American Bully, "Tunda," was transported from Honolulu to Boston on flight HA090 on May 31st, 2023 (AWB 
173-11228571). On the exterior of the enclosure, there was a "Live Animal Checklist" form with a space for a certification 
by the consignor of the last time food and water was offered and for feeding instructions over a 24 hour period, but that 
section of the form was blank. The dog was transported without this required information. The certification and feeding 
and watering instructions are important to ensure an animal being transported is offered food and water with sufficient 
frequency to provide for the animal's health and well being.  
 
Carriers and intermediate handlers must not accept a dog for transport in commerce unless the consignor certifies in 
writing that the dog was offered food and water within 4 hours of transport and provides specific instructions for feeding 
and watering in a 24 hour period. The certification and instructions must be securely attached to the outside of the 
enclosure and easily read. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with airline representatives. 
 
 n
